_comment: The code is the source of truth for English phrases. They should be updated in the components directly, and additional plurals specified in this file.

permissions.permissions-change-warning: This will change permissions for this folder and all its descendants. In total, this will affect:
permissions.title: Permissions

description.text: Define how the alert rule is evaluated.

info-help.text: Define the alert behavior when the evaluation fails or the query returns no data.

alert-rule-form.evaluation-behaviour-description1: Evaluation groups are containers for evaluating alert and recording rules.
alert-rule-form.evaluation-behaviour-description2: An evaluation group defines an evaluation interval - how often a rule is evaluated. Alert rules within the same evaluation group are evaluated over the same evaluation interval.
alert-rule-form.evaluation-behaviour-description3: Pending period specifies how long the threshold condition must be met before the alert starts firing. This option helps prevent alerts from being triggered by temporary issues.

evaluation-behaviour-for.validation: Pending period must be greater than or equal to the evaluation interval.

evaluation-behaviour-group.text: All rules in the selected group are evaluated every {{evaluateEvery}}.

details.error: Error loading rule for this event.
details.not-found: Rule not found for this event.

central-alert-history.error: Something went wrong loading the alert state history

info.label1: Filter events using label querying without spaces, ex:
info.label4: Filter alerts using label querying without braces, ex:

too-many-events.text: The selected time period has too many events to display. Diplaying the latest 5000 events. Try using a shorter time period.
too-many-events.title: Unable to display all events

telegram.parse-mode-warning-body: If you use a <1>parse_mode</1> option other than <3>None</3>, truncation may result in an invalid message, causing the notification to fail. For longer messages, we recommend using an alternative contact method.
telegram.parse-mode-warning-title: Telegram messages are limited to 4096 UTF-8 characters.

error-loading.description: Could not load mute timings. Please try again later.
error-loading.title: Error loading mute timings

default-policy.description: All alert instances will be handled by the default policy if no other matching policies are found.
default-policy.title: Default policy

groupInterval.description: How long to wait before sending a notification about new alerts that are added to a group of alerts for which an initial notification has already been sent.
groupInterval.label: Wait <1></1> before sending updates

groupWait.description: How long to initially wait to send a notification for a group of alert instances.
groupWait.label: Wait <1></1> to group instances

repeatInterval.description: How often notifications are sent if the group of alerts has not changed since the last notification.
repeatInterval.label: Repeated every <1></1>

provisioning.badge-tooltip-provenance: This resource has been provisioned via {{provenance}} and cannot be edited through the UI
provisioning.badge-tooltip-standard: This resource has been provisioned and cannot be edited through the UI

empty-state.info-box-content: <0>Annotations provide a way to integrate event data into your graphs. They are visualized as vertical lines and icons on all graph panels. When you hover over an annotation icon you can get event text & tags for the event. You can add annotation events directly from grafana by holding CTRL or CMD + click on graph (or drag region). These will be stored in Grafana's annotation database.</0>
empty-state.info-box-content-2: Checkout the <2>Annotations documentation</2> for more information.
empty-state.title: There are no custom annotation queries added yet

empty.message: It looks like you haven’t created any bookmarks yet
empty.tip: Hover over any item in the nav menu and click on the bookmark icon to add it here.

action.delete-modal-invalid-text: One or more folders contain library panels or alert rules. Delete these first in order to proceed.
action.delete-modal-restore-dashboards-text: This action will delete the selected folders immediately but the selected dashboards will be marked for deletion in 30 days. Your organization administrator can restore the dashboards anytime before the 30 days expire. Folders cannot be restored.
action.delete-modal-text: This action will delete the following content:
action.move-modal-alert: Moving this item may change its permissions.
action.move-modal-text: This action will move the following content:

empty-state.pro-tip: Add/move dashboards to your folder at <2>Browse dashboards</2>
empty-state.title: You haven't created any dashboards yet
empty-state.title-folder: This folder doesn't have any dashboards yet

no-results.text: No results found for your query

connect-data.empty-message: No results matching your query were found

alert.error-message: An unknown error occurred while fetching correlation data. Please try again.
alert.title: Error fetching correlation data

basic-info-form.description-description: Optional description with more information about the link
basic-info-form.label-description: This name will be used as the label for the correlation. This will show as button text, a menu item, or hover text on a link.
basic-info-form.sub-text: <0>Define text that will describe the correlation.</0>
basic-info-form.title: Define correlation label (Step 1 of 3)

empty-state.pro-tip: You can also define correlations via datasource provisioning
empty-state.title: You haven't defined any correlations yet

correlations.page-content: To enable Correlations, add it in the Grafana config:

query-editor.control-rules: The selected target data source must export a query editor.
query-editor.data-source-text: Please select a target data source first.
query-editor.error-text: The selected data source could not be loaded.
query-editor.query-description: Define the query that is run when the link is clicked. You can use <2>variables</2> to access specific field values.
query-editor.query-editor-title: Data source does not export a query editor.

source-form.description: You have used following variables in the target query: <1></1><2></2>A data point needs to provide values to all variables as fields or as transformations output to make the correlation button appear in the visualization.<4></4>Note: Not every variable needs to be explicitly defined below. A transformation such as <7>logfmt</7> will create variables for every key/value pair.
source-form.heading: Variables used in the target query
source-form.results-description: The link will be shown next to the value of this field
source-form.source-description: Results from selected source data source have links displayed in the panel
source-form.sub-text: <0>Define what data source will display the correlation, and what data will replace previously defined variables.</0>
source-form.title: Configure the data source that will link to {{dataSourceName}} (Step 3 of 3)

correlations.sub-title: Define how data living in different data sources relates to each other. Read more in the <2>documentation<1></1></2>

target-form.sub-text: <0>Define what data source the correlation will link to, and what query will run when the correlation is clicked.</0>
target-form.target-description: Specify which data source is queried when the link is clicked
target-form.title: Setup the target for the correlation (Step 2 of 3)

trans-details.logfmt-description: Parse provided field with logfmt to get variables
trans-details.regex-description: Field will be parsed with regex. Use named capture groups to return multiple variables, or a single unnamed capture group to add variable to named map value. Regex is case insensitive.
trans-details.regex-expression: Use capture groups to extract a portion of the field.
trans-details.regex-map-values: Defines the name of the variable if the capture group is not named.

transform-row.expression-tooltip: Required for regular expression. The expression the transformation will use. Logfmt does not use further specifications.
transform-row.field-tooltip: Optional. The field to transform. If not specified, the transformation will be applied to the results field.
transform-row.map-value-tooltip: Optional. Defines the name of the variable. This is currently only valid for regular expressions with a single, unnamed capture group.
transform-row.type-tooltip: The type of transformation that will be applied to the source data.

alert-rules-drawer.subtitle: Alert rules related to this dashboard

empty.add-library-panel-body: Add visualizations that are shared with other dashboards.
empty.add-visualization-body: Select a data source and then query and visualize your data with charts, stats and tables or create lists, markdowns and other widgets.
empty.add-visualization-header: Start your new dashboard by adding a visualization
empty.add-widget-body: Create lists, markdowns and other widgets

inspect.subtitle: {{queryCount}} queries with total query time of {{formatted}}
inspect.title: Inspect: {{panelTitle}}

inspect-data.download-excel-description: Adds header to CSV for use with Excel
inspect-data.formatted-data-description: Table data is formatted with options defined in the Field and Override tabs.
inspect-data.transformations-description: Table data is displayed with transformations defined in the panel Transform tab.

inspect-json.dataframe-description: Raw data without transformations and field config applied.
inspect-json.panel-data-description: The raw model passed to the panel visualization
inspect-json.panel-json-description: The model saved in the dashboard JSON that configures how everything works.

validation.invalid-dashboard-id: Could not find a valid Grafana.com ID

file-dropzone.secondary-text: Drag and drop here or click to browse

gcom-field.label: Find and import dashboards for common applications at <1></1>
gcom-field.validation-required: A Grafana dashboard URL or ID is required

empty-state.info-box-content: Dashboard links allow you to place links to other dashboards and web sites directly below the dashboard header. <2>Learn more</2>
empty-state.title: There are no dashboard links added yet

dashboard-settings.delete-modal-restore-dashboards-text: This action will mark the dashboard for deletion in 30 days. Your organization administrator can restore it anytime before the 30 days expire.
dashboard-settings.delete-modal-text: Do you want to delete this dashboard?

general.auto-refresh-description: Define the auto refresh intervals that should be available in the auto refresh list. Use the format '5s' for seconds, '1m' for minutes, '1h' for hours, and '1d' for days (e.g.: '5s,10s,30s,1m,5m,15m,30m,1h,2h,1d').
general.editable-description: Set to read-only to disable all editing. Reload the dashboard for changes to take effect
general.panel-options-graph-tooltip-description: Controls tooltip and hover highlight behavior across different panels. Reload the dashboard for changes to take effect
general.panels-preload-description: When enabled all panels will start loading as soon as the dashboard has been loaded.
general.title: General

json-editor.subtitle: The JSON model below is the data structure that defines the dashboard. This includes dashboard settings, panel settings, layout, queries, and so on.
json-editor.title: JSON Model

provisioned-delete-modal.text-1: This dashboard is managed by Grafana provisioning and cannot be deleted. Remove the dashboard from the config file to delete it.
provisioned-delete-modal.text-2: See grafana documentation for more information about provisioning.
provisioned-delete-modal.title: Cannot delete provisioned dashboard

time-picker.now-delay-description: Exclude recent data that may be incomplete.
time-picker.refresh-live-dashboards-description: Continuously re-draw panels where the time range references 'now'

empty-state.pro-tip: You can also define data sources through configuration files. <2>Learn more</2>
empty-state.title: No data sources defined

built-in-list.description-dashboard: Reuse query results from other visualizations

modal.configure-new-data-source: Open a new tab and configure a data source
modal.title: Select data source

share.time-range-description: Change the current relative time range to an absolute time range

annotations.datasource: The selected data source does not support annotations. Please select a different data source.

logs.maximum-pinned-logs: Maximum of {{PINNED_LOGS_LIMIT}} pinned logs reached. Unpin a log to add another.

query-library.delete-query-text: You're about to remove this query from the query library. This action cannot be undone. Do you want to continue?
query-library.query-template-add-error: Error attempting to add this query to the library
query-library.query-template-added: Query template successfully added to the library
query-library.query-template-edit-error: Error attempting to edit this query

query-template-modal.add-info: You're about to save this query. Once saved, you can easily access it in the Query Library tab for future use and reference.
query-template-modal.auto-star: Auto-star this query to add it to your starred list in the Query Library.
query-template-modal.edit-info: You're about to edit this query. Once saved, you can easily access it in the Query Library tab for future use and reference.

rich-history-card.datasource-not-exist: Data source does not exist anymore
rich-history-card.delete-starred-query-confirmation-text: Are you sure you want to permanently delete your starred query?
rich-history-card.optional-description: An optional description of what the query does.

rich-history-queries-tab.history-local: The history is local to your browser and is not shared with others.

rich-history-settings-tab.alert-info: Grafana will keep entries up to {{optionLabel}}.Starred entries won't be deleted.
rich-history-settings-tab.change-default-tab: Change the default active tab from “Query history” to “Starred”
rich-history-settings-tab.clear-history-info: Delete all of your query history, permanently.
rich-history-settings-tab.delete-confirm-text: Are you sure you want to permanently delete your query history?
rich-history-settings-tab.history-time-span-description: Select the period of time for which Grafana will save your query history. Up to {{MAX_HISTORY_ITEMS}} entries will be stored.
rich-history-settings-tab.only-show-active-datasource: Only show queries for data source currently active in Explore

rich-history-starred-tab.local-history-message: The history is local to your browser and is not shared with others.

run-query.switch-datasource-button: Switch data source and run query

toolbar.copy-links-absolute-category: Time-sync URL links (share with time range intact)

json.export-externally-label: Export the dashboard to use in another instance
json.info-text: Copy or download a JSON file containing the JSON of your dashboard
json.title: Save dashboard JSON

container.content: Rendering too many series in a single panel may impact performance and make data harder to read. Consider refining your queries.
container.title: Graph

query.description: Query inspector allows you to view raw request and response. To collect this data Grafana needs to issue a new query. Click refresh button below to trigger a new query.
query.no-data: No request and response collected yet. Hit refresh button

attributes-section.description: Specify the LDAP attributes that map to the user‘s given name, surname, and email address, ensuring the application correctly retrieves and displays user information.
attributes-section.label: Attributes

min-tls-version.description: This is the minimum TLS version allowed. Accepted values are: TLS1.2, TLS1.3.
min-tls-version.label: Min TLS version

start-tls.description: If set to true, use LDAP with STARTTLS instead of LDAPS
start-tls.label: Start TLS

tls-ciphers.description: List of comma- or space-separated ciphers
tls-ciphers.label: TLS ciphers

use-ssl.description: Set to true if LDAP server should use TLS connection (either with STARTTLS or LDAPS)
use-ssl.label: Use SSL

group-mapping-section.description: Map LDAP groups to Grafana org roles

group-search-filter.description: Used to filter and identify group entries within the directory
group-search-filter.label: Group search filter

group-search-filter-user-attribute.description: Identifies users within group entries for filtering purposes
group-search-filter-user-attribute.label: Group name attribute

group-mapping-section.label: Group mapping

skip-org-role-sync.description: Prevent synchronizing users’ organization roles from your IdP
skip-org-role-sync.label: Skip organization role sync

allow-sign-up.descrition: If not enabled, only existing Grafana users can log in using LDAP
allow-sign-up.label: Allow sign up

port.description: Default port is 389 without SSL or 636 with SSL
port.label: Port

timeout.description: Timeout in seconds for the connection to the LDAP server
timeout.label: Timeout

advanced-settings-section.subtitle: Mappings, extra security measures, and more.
advanced-settings-section.title: Advanced Settings

alert.feature-flag-disabled: This page is only accessible by enabling the <1>ssoSettingsLDAP</1> feature flag.

bind-dn.description: Distinguished name of the account used to bind and authenticate to the LDAP server.
bind-dn.label: Bind DN

host.description: Hostname or IP address of the LDAP server you wish to connect to.
host.label: Server host

search_filter.description: LDAP search filter used to locate specific entries within the directory.
search_filter.label: Search filter*

search-base-dns.description: An array of base dns to search through; separate by commas or spaces.
search-base-dns.label: Search base DNS *

ldap-settings-page.subtitle: The LDAP integration in Grafana allows your Grafana users to log in with their LDAP credentials. Find out more in our {documentation}.
ldap-settings-page.title: Basic Settings

add-modal.error: Library panel with this name already exists
add-modal.folder-description: Library panel permissions are derived from the folder permissions
add-modal.name: Library panel name

empty-state.message: You haven't created any library panels yet
empty-state.more-info: Create a library panel from any existing dashboard panel through the panel context menu. <2>Learn more</2>

modal.body_one: This panel is being used in {{count}} dashboard. Please choose which dashboard to view the panel in:
modal.body_other: This panel is being used in {{count}} dashboard. Please choose which dashboard to view the panel in:
modal.panel-not-linked: Panel is not linked to a dashboard. Add the panel to a dashboard and retry.
modal.select-placeholder: Start typing to search for dashboard
modal.title: View panel in dashboard

share.config-alert-description: Updating your settings will modify the default copy link to include these changes. Please note that these settings are saved within your current browser scope.
share.config-description: Create a personalized, direct link to share your dashboard within your organization, with the following customization settings:
share.time-range-description: Change the current relative time range to an absolute time range

share-panel.config-description: Create a personalized, direct link to share your panel within your organization, with the following customization settings:

error.blocked: You have exceeded the number of login attempts for this user. Please try again later.
error.title: Login failed

build-snapshot.description: This tool can migrate some resources from this installation to your cloud stack. To get started, you'll need to create a snapshot of this installation. Creating a snapshot typically takes less than two minutes. The snapshot is stored alongside this Grafana installation.
build-snapshot.title: No snapshot exists
build-snapshot.when-complete: Once the snapshot is complete, you will be able to upload it to your cloud stack.

building-snapshot.description: We're creating a point-in-time snapshot of the current state of this installation. Once the snapshot is complete. you'll be able to upload it to Grafana Cloud.
building-snapshot.description-eta: Creating a snapshot typically takes less than two minutes.
building-snapshot.title: Building installation snapshot

can-i-move.body: Once you connect this installation to a cloud stack, you'll be able to upload data sources and dashboards.
can-i-move.title: Can I move this installation to Grafana Cloud?

connect-modal.body-cloud-stack: You'll also need a cloud stack. If you just signed up, we'll automatically create your first stack. If you have an account, you'll need to select or create a stack.
connect-modal.body-get-started: To get started, you'll need a Grafana.com account.
connect-modal.body-sign-up: Sign up for a Grafana.com account
connect-modal.body-token: Your self-managed Grafana installation needs special access to securely migrate content. You'll need to create a migration token on your chosen cloud stack.
connect-modal.body-token-instructions: Log into your cloud stack and navigate to Administration, General, Migrate to Grafana Cloud. Create a migration token on that screen and paste the token here.
connect-modal.title: Connect to a cloud stack
connect-modal.token-error-description: There was an error saving the token. See the Grafana server logs for more details.

cta.header: Let us manage your Grafana stack

delete-migration-token-confirm.body: If you've already used this token with a self-managed installation, that installation will no longer be able to upload content.
delete-migration-token-confirm.title: Delete migration token

disconnect-modal.body: This will remove the migration token from this installation. If you wish to upload more resources in the future, you will need to enter a new migration token.
disconnect-modal.title: Disconnect from cloud stack

get-started.body: The migration process must be started from your self-managed Grafana instance.
get-started.link-title: Learn more about Private Data Source Connect
get-started.step-1: Log in to your self-managed instance and navigate to Administration, General, Migrate to Grafana Cloud.
get-started.step-3: You'll be prompted for a migration token. Generate one from this screen.
get-started.step-4: In your self-managed instance, select "Upload everything" to upload data sources and dashboards to this cloud stack.
get-started.step-5: If some of your data sources will not work over the public internet, you’ll need to install Private Data Source Connect in your self-managed environment.
get-started.title: Performing a migration

is-it-secure.body: Grafana Labs is committed to maintaining the highest standards of data privacy and security. By implementing industry-standard security technologies and procedures, we help protect our customers' data from unauthorized access, use, or disclosure.
is-it-secure.title: Is it secure?

migrate-to-this-stack.body: You can migrate some resources from your self-managed Grafana installation to this cloud stack. To do this securely, you'll need to generate a migration token. Your self-managed instance will use the token to authenticate with this cloud stack.
migrate-to-this-stack.title: Let us help you migrate to this stack

migration-token.delete-modal-body: If you've already used this token with a self-managed installation, that installation will no longer be able to upload content.
migration-token.error-body: Unable to generate a migration token. Please try again later.
migration-token.modal-field-description: Copy the token now as you will not be able to see it again. Losing a token requires creating a new one.

onprem.error-see-server-logs: See the Grafana server logs for more details
onprem.migration-finished-with-errors-body: The migration has completed, but some items could not be migrated to the cloud stack. Check the failed resources for more details
onprem.migration-finished-with-warnings-body: The migration has completed with some warnings. Check individual resources for more details
onprem.snapshot-error-status-body: There was an error creating the snapshot or starting the migration process. See the Grafana server logs for more details
onprem.success-message: Successfully migrated {{successCount}} {{types, list}} to your Grafana Cloud instance.

pdc.body: Exposing your data sources to the internet can raise security concerns. Private data source connect (PDC) allows Grafana Cloud to access your existing data sources over a secure network tunnel.
pdc.title: Not all my data sources are on the public internet

pricing.body: Grafana Cloud has a generous free plan and a 14 day unlimited usage trial. After your trial expires, you'll be billed based on usage over the free plan limits.
pricing.title: How much does it cost?

public-preview.message: No SLAs are available yet. <2>Visit our docs</2> to learn more about this feature!
public-preview.title: Migrate to Grafana Cloud is in public preview

support-types-disclosure.text: Dashboards, Folders, and built-in core data sources are migrated to your Grafana Cloud stack. <2>Learn about migrating other settings.</2>

what-is-cloud.body: Grafana cloud is a fully managed cloud-hosted observability platform ideal for cloud native environments. It's everything you love about Grafana without the overhead of maintaining, upgrading, and supporting an installation.
what-is-cloud.title: What is Grafana Cloud?

why-host.body: In addition to the convenience of managed hosting, Grafana Cloud includes many cloud-exclusive features like SLOs, incident management, machine learning, and powerful observability integrations.
why-host.link-title: More questions? Talk to an expert
why-host.title: Why host with Grafana?

email-sharing.bill-ack: I understand that adding users requires payment.*
email-sharing.recipient-invitation-tooltip: This dashboard contains sensitive data. By using this feature you will be sharing with external people.

email-sharing.success-creation: Your dashboard is ready for external sharing
email-sharing.success-share-type-change: Dashboard access restricted: Only specific people can now access with the link

modal-alerts.no-upsert-perm-alert-desc: Contact your admin to get permission to {{mode}} public dashboards
modal-alerts.no-upsert-perm-alert-title: You don’t have permission to {{ mode }} a public dashboard
modal-alerts.save-dashboard-changes-alert-title: Please save your dashboard changes before updating the public configuration
modal-alerts.unsupport-data-source-alert-readmore-lin: Read more about supported data sources
modal-alerts.unsupported-data-source-alert-desc: There are data sources in this dashboard that are unsupported for public dashboards. Panels that use these data sources may not function properly: {{unsupportedDataSources}}.
modal-alerts.unsupported-template-variable-alert-desc: This public dashboard may not work since it uses template variables

public-sharing.alert-text: Sharing this dashboard externally makes it entirely accessible to anyone with the link.
public-sharing.public-ack: I understand that this entire dashboard will be public.*
public-sharing.success-creation: Your dashboard is now publicly accessible
public-sharing.success-share-type-change: Dashboard access updated: Anyone with the link can now access

settings-configuration.default-time-range-label-desc: The public dashboard uses the default time range settings of the dashboard
settings-configuration.time-range-picker-label-desc: Allow viewers to change time range

share.success-delete: Your dashboard is no longer shareable

share-externally.email-share-type-option-description: Only people with the link can access dashboard
share-externally.pause-access-tooltip: Pausing will temporarily disable access to this dashboard for all users
share-externally.public-share-type-option-description: Anyone with the link can access dashboard
share-externally.revoke-access-description: Are you sure you want to revoke this access? The dashboard can no longer be shared.

empty-state.message: You haven't created any public dashboards yet
empty-state.more-info: Create a public dashboard from any existing dashboard through the <1>Share</1> modal. <4>Learn more</4>

delete-user-modal.revoke-user-access-modal-desc-line1: Are you sure you want to revoke access for {{email}}?
delete-user-modal.revoke-user-access-modal-desc-line2: This action will immediately revoke {{email}}'s access to all public dashboards.

delete-user-shared-dashboards-modal.revoke-user-access-modal-desc-line2: This action will immediately revoke {{email}}'s access to all shared dashboards.

table-header.activated-tooltip: Earliest time user has been an active user to a dashboard

query-operation.query-editor-not-exported: Data source plugin does not export any Query Editor component

page.no-deleted-dashboards: You haven't deleted any dashboards recently.
page.no-deleted-dashboards-text: When you delete a dashboard, it will appear here for 30 days before being permanently deleted. Your organization administrator can restore recently-deleted dashboards.
page.no-search-result: No results found for your query

restore-modal.folder-picker-text_one: Please choose a folder where your dashboard will be restored.
restore-modal.folder-picker-text_other: Please choose a folder where your dashboards will be restored.
restore-modal.title: Restore Dashboards

aria-label.choose-interval: Auto refresh turned off. Choose refresh time interval
aria-label.duration-selected: Choose refresh time interval with current interval {{durationAriaLabel}} selected

name-exists.message-info: A dashboard with the same name in the selected folder already exists, including recently deleted dashboards.
name-exists.message-suggestion: Please choose a different name or folder.
name-exists.title: Dashboard name already exists

dashboards.noResultsForFilter: No results found for your query
dashboards.noResultsForScopes: No dashboards found for the selected scopes

toggle.disabled: Suggested dashboards list is disabled due to read only mode

headline.noResults: No results found for your query

search-input.include-panels-placeholder: Search for dashboards, folders, and panels

empty-state.more-info: Remember, you can provide specific permissions for API access to other applications
empty-state.title: You haven't created any service accounts yet

embed.html-description: The HTML code below can be pasted and included in another web page. Unless anonymous access is enabled, the user viewing that page need to be signed into Grafana for the graph to load.
embed.info: Generate HTML for embedding an iframe with this panel.

link.info-text: Create a direct link to this dashboard or panel, customized with the options below.
link.render-instructions: To render a panel image, you must install the <2>Grafana image renderer plugin</2>. Please contact your Grafana administrator to install the plugin.
link.save-dashboard: To render a panel image, you must save the dashboard first.
link.time-range-description: Transforms the current relative time range to an absolute time range

snapshot.deleted-message: The snapshot has been deleted. If you have already accessed it once, then it might take up to an hour before before it is removed from browser caches or CDN caches.
snapshot.info-text-1: A snapshot is an instant way to share an interactive dashboard publicly. When created, we strip sensitive data like queries (metric, template, and annotation) and panel links, leaving only the visible metric data and series names embedded in your dashboard.
snapshot.info-text-2: Keep in mind, your snapshot <1>can be viewed by anyone</1> that has the link and can access the URL. Share wisely.
snapshot.name: Snapshot name
snapshot.timeout-description: You might need to configure the timeout value if it takes a long time to collect your dashboard metrics.

share-playlist.checkbox-description: Panel heights will be adjusted to fit screen size
share-playlist.title: Share playlist

delete-modal.revoke-body-text: Are you sure you want to revoke this access? The dashboard can no longer be shared.

empty-state.message: You haven't created any shared dashboards yet
empty-state.more-info: Create a shared dashboard from any existing dashboard through the <1>Share</1> modal. <4>Learn more</4>

empty-state.title: You haven't created any silences yet

table.expired-silences: Expired silences are automatically deleted after 5 days.
table.noConfig: Create a new contact point to create a configuration using the default values or contact your administrator to set up the Alertmanager.

empty-state.message: You haven't created any snapshots yet
empty-state.more-info: You can create a snapshot of any dashboard through the <1>Share</1> modal. <4>Learn more</4>

share.delete-description: Are you sure you want to delete this snapshot?
share.deleted-alert: Your snapshot has been deleted. It might take up to an hour before the snapshot is cleared from any CDN caches.
share.info-alert: A Grafana dashboard snapshot publicly shares a dashboard while removing sensitive data such as queries and panel links, leaving only visible metrics and series names. Anyone with the link can access the snapshot.

share-panel.info-alert: A Grafana panel snapshot publicly shares a panel while removing sensitive data such as queries and panel links, leaving only visible metrics and series names. Anyone with the link can access the snapshot.

empty-state.pro-tip: Assign folder and dashboard permissions to teams instead of users to ease administration. <2>Learn more</2>
empty-state.title: You haven't created any teams yet

content.empty-recent-list-docs: <0><0>Read the documentation</0><1> to find out more about how to enter custom time ranges.</1></0>
content.empty-recent-list-info: It looks like you haven't used this time picker before. As soon as you enter some time intervals, recently used intervals will appear here.

copy-paste.default-error-message: {{error}} is not a valid time range

range-content.default-error: Please enter a past date or "now"

empty.add-transformation-body: Transformations allow data to be changed in various ways before your visualization is shown.<1></1>This includes joining data together, renaming fields, making calculations, formatting data for display, and more.

empty-state.info-box-content: Variables enable more interactive and dynamic dashboards. Instead of hard-coding things like server or sensor names in your metric queries you can use variables in their place. Variables are shown as list boxes at the top of the dashboard. These drop-down lists make it easy to change the data being displayed in your dashboard.
empty-state.info-box-content-2: Check out the <2>Templates and variables documentation</2> for more information.
empty-state.title: There are no variables added yet
